>
My son, who is allergic to cow dairy, has recently
shown that he can tolerate goat dairy. While I don't
mind paying more for things like goat yogurt or goat
ice cream, I think it's crazy that I'm paying $4 or
more for a quart of goat milk at the grocery store. I
live in southeast Michigan right next to Toledo Ohio,
and I have been searching the past week for anyone who
lives near me who has dairy goats. I understand that
the law is that the owner cannot give us goat milk,
but if we have a share of the goat, we can receive
some of its milk.

So, I'm asking everywhere... if you know a person who
lives near Toledo Ohio who has dairy goats who would
be interested in a goat share, can you please contact
me? I think my son would love to own part of a goat
anyways (he's a big animal lover) and it would be a
great load off my mind. Thanks again.

__________________________________________________________
